extendedInfo.description: Match all the cute animals and the technical tools with the shape of the object in the middle of the game. Toddlers will develop their visual perception and cognitive skills. The simple drag & drop mechanism also helps to train the fine motor skills of your kid. The game interface is kid-friendly and does not overload your kid with too many stimuli. Within three different themes, over 50 different objects can be matched one after another. Each game has a nicely illustrated image with 8 related images around. Just drag the matching object into the middle of the screen. Features:â¢ a fun pair matching game for toddlersâ¢ over 50 cute animals and kid-friendly graphicsâ¢ trains fine motor skillsâ¢ develops cognitive skillsâ¢ develops visual perception skillsThree themes: African Animals: Monkey, elephant, donkey, giraffe, gorilla, hippo, crocodile, lion, palm tree, turtle, snake, ostrich, tiger, zebraTechnical tools: dredge, hammer, crane, casing tongs, buzz saw, truck, air hammer, bear, workerFarm: Pear, duck, cock, dog, cat, chick, cow, carrot, orange, horse, sheep, barn, pig, cloudAge group: 2 +Keywords: 3, autism, baby, bear, cat, child, cognitive, drag, drop, education, find, fun, game, jigsaw, kindergarten, logic, memo, memory, pairs, parenting, pony, preschool, puzzle, riddle, school, shape, skills, teddy, tiger, trainer

reviews.title: My kid learnt his first words with this game
reviews.comment: My son was diagnosed with ASD few months back. This game helped me label different items for him. He quickly picked up words and also learned to play the game by himself. Its truly a well designed and well concerted effort.
reviews.author: Muhammad Emad

reviews.title: Banner adds! Really?
reviews.comment: Whoever publishes this app obviously has no soul. To put an app out into the ether made for special needs children that contains Banner Adds is just plain wrong. Buyer beware!
reviews.author: Michael Kelley
